WorkItem.Description: When using AutoGenerateColumns="true" to bind to a DataTable that has a column with a period (.) in its name (for example, "my.columnName"), then the column will render in the DataGrid, but the cells will not display any data.
WorkItem.Summary: AutoGenerateColumns fails when column name contains a period

Comments.Message: Thanks for reporting this.  If the column header contains a '.' the WPF data binding engine can't distinguish this from a property path; unfortunately you won't be able to use a '.' in your name.
Why is the status of this item fixed?  It is common to have a period in a column name when you are joining multiple tables and need to disambiguate the column name.

This issue is not specific to '.'
This happens for most of the punctuation marks. Are you going to fix this with any of your future version?
I second hrkyemba's comment -- this is a showstopper for us. At the very least we need some way to work around this; our other alternative is to stop using the DataGrid altogether.
